news.description: Lars Mattison presented a research poster at the 1st World Congress of Electroporation in Slovenia (September 6-10, 2015).

Megan Schmidt successfully passed her oral preliminary exams on September 11th (OPE title: Utility of Monophasic Action Potentials as a Means of Monitoring Electrophysiologic Function during the Diagnosis and Treatment of Cardiac Arrhythmias). Congratulations Megan!

Kathryn Thomas presented her research poster at the CTSI Fall Scholar and Mentor Reception on September 17th, and was recognized with a travel award of $1,500 to present her research at an upcoming national conference. These awards were distributed to the top posters based on presenter translation plans, including next steps, barriers to translation, and how the project will contribute to improving human health.

The manuscript 'Visualization of catheter ablation for atrial fibrillation: impact of devices and anatomy' was accepted for publication in the World Journal of Cardiology. Congrats to co-authors Mark Benscoter and Paul Iaizzo!!

The manuscript 'Isometric skeletal muscle force measurement in primary myopathies' was accepted for publication in Muscle & Nerve (DOI: 10.1002/mus.24954). Congrats to co-authors Hans Ginz, Paul Iaizzo, K Schweikert, and Will Durfee!

Jamilisse Segarra received a travel award to participate in the 2015 Annual Biomedical Research Conference for Minority Students (ABRCMS) in Washington state (Nov. 11-14). She also received an Award in the Disciplines of Physics, Math, and Engineering for her poster 'Effects of Laser-Cutting in Muscle Tissue Biomechanics.'
news.more: Jamilisse Segarra's abstract 'Effects of Laser-Cutting in Muscle Tissue Biomechanics' was accepted for a poster presentation at the Emerging Researchers National (ERN) Conference in STEM (Washington DC, February 25-27, 2016). Congratulations Jamilisse!

news.description: Paul Iaizzo received a $15K grant from the James B. Linsmayer Foundation to support research on 'Development of 3D Human Torso Models.' These models will be used to educate clinicians, students at all levels, and patients on cardiac anatomy and to provide computational models for virtual medical device prototyping and development.
The Lillehei Heart Institute awarded Dr. Paul Iaizzo an additional $50K to continue our efforts in youth education for 2016.

Dr. Robroy MacIver awarded our lab with funding (~$8,300) to support efforts related to the 3D Imaging of Congenital Hearts project. This project challenges us to: 1) image select cadaveric hearts from the Jesse Edwards Heart Registry; 2) coordinate local hospitals to obtain unique congenital images, then supply these hospitals with 3D images for patient and provider education; 3) create 3D printed hearts for U of MN professors, MDs, and nurses for instruction of students; and 4) create 3D printed hearts for patient families for discussions of their childrens' heart defects.

Lars Mattison will present his project 'A device to aid in quantifying lung compliance and edema' in the Three-in-Five Competition at the Design of Medical Devices Conference on Wednesday, April 13th (8-10am, The Commons Hotel, Meridian Ballrooms 2/3). Presenters will describe their medical devices within 5-minutes using no more than 3 slides. Leaders in the field of medical technology research, engineering and development will judge presentations on: 1) quality of clinical need statement (problem); 2) technical soundness of research (solution); 3) presentation quality; and 3) fundability. The top 3 presenters will be awarded $500 and be announced at the conference Keynote Luncheon on Thursday, April 14th. Good luck Lars!

Alex Mattson will present his abstract 'A novel bench-top isolated atrial preparation for testing atrial pacing and ablation technologies' at CardioStim 2016 in Nice, France (June 8-11, 2016). Alex will also present an abstract 'Acute perforation properties of the right atrial appendage' at ACC 2016 Scientific Sessions in Chicago (April 2-4, 2016). A technical brief 'Acute perforation properties of the right atrial appendage' was also accepted into the Design of Medical Devices Conference in Minneapolis (April 12-14, 2016). Congrats Alex!

A production team of three individuals from TeamWorks Media visited the Visible Heart Laboratory on Tuesday, October 18th. As part of a LiveBIG campaign, TeamWorks Media, in partnership with the Big Ten Network, produces 1-min video vignettes on various college campuses that air during Big Ten sporting events in stadiums and arenas, and are also shared online. This fall they chose to shine the spotlight on the Visible Heart Lab. They were specifically interested in: the history of the lab where pioneering heart surgeries and transplant research were performed from the 1950s onward; our long standing research partnership with Medtronic; our unique ability to routinely reanimate large mammalian hearts with a clear perfusate (including 73 human hearts deemed not viable for transplant); the number (hundreds) and diversity of scientists, research collaborators, clinicians, and students that visit or work in our lab annually; the free-access Atlas of Human Cardiac Anatomy which serves as an educational resource for clinicians, engineers, patients and students of all levels (>5,000 downloadable images and movies plus tutorials); our human heart library that currently contains 400+ human heart specimens available for study; our ability to train new generations of engineers that become leaders in the medical device industry; our various outreach educational opportunities that teach cardiac anatomy, physiology and devices to people of all ages; our cardiac modeling and 3D printing capabilities.

Paul Iaizzo presented two talks 1) 'Innovation on the Edge,' University of Minnesota Alumni, Red Wing, MN, March 22, 2016; and 2) 'The Visible Heart Laboratory and the Atlas of Human Cardiac Anatomy,' Symposium on Biomedical Image Processing: From Fundamental Concepts to Clinical Translation, Ecole Polytechnique de Montreal, Montreal, Canada, March 24, 2016.
The University of Minnesota Foundation just announced that the VHL will receive a gift of $70K from Dr. Earl Bakken to support graduate students.

Kathryn Thomas will present her abstract/poster 'Assessing muscle protection with pharmacological post-conditioning agents in an acute ischemia reperfusion model' on April 6th at Experimental Biology 2016 in San Diego.

CONGRATULATIONS to co-authors Ashish Singal, John Ballard, Eric Rudie, Erik Cressman, and Paul Iaizzo on the publication of their paper 'A review of therapeutic ablation modalities' in the Journal of Medical Devices.

The manuscript 'Isometric skeletal muscle force measurement in primary myopathies' has been published in Muscle & Nerve (June 2016 issue). Congrats to co-authors Hans Ginz, Paul Iaizzo, Kathi Schweikert, and Will Durfee!
CONGRATULATIONS to Ross Hinrichsen who presented his thesis 'Mechanical properties of the aortic arch as a function of growth' and earned his masters degree in Biomedical Engineering on July 11.
news.more: CONGRATULATIONS to Jeremy Stimack who also presented his thesis 'The effects of voltage and pulse number on the peak contraction force of swine esophageal muscularis post-application of irreversible electroporation over time' and earned his masters degree in Biomedical Engineering on July 11.

news.description: CONGRATULATIONS to Ross Hinrichsen who presented his thesis 'Mechanical properties of the aortic arch as a function of growth' and earned his masters degree in Biomedical Engineering on July 11.
Lab staff, graduate students, and volunteers hosted an all-day exhibit on cardiac anatomy and physiology at the Minnesota State Fair on Thursday, September 1st.
Alex Mattson passed his oral preliminary exam on September 12, 2016 (Title: Cardiac anatomy and material property studies for novel pacemaker fixation). CONGRATS Alex!

Staff and graduate/medical students from the Visible Heart Lab hosted educational exhibits at the Medical Design & Manufacturing Conference (September 21, Minneapolis Convention Center) and 2016 IEM Conference and Retreat (September 26, McNamara Alumni Center).
CONGRATS to Paul Rothstein and Paul Iaizzo on their US Patent 9,445,797 (Percutaneous atrial and ventricular septal defect closure device) which was issued on September 20, 2016!
Paul Iaizzo was named as an IEEE Senior Member in recognition of significant contributions to his profession. CONGRATULATIONS!!

The manuscript 'Bears habituate to the repeated exposure of a novel stimulus, unmanned aircraft systems' has been published in Conservation Physiology (Open Access article. 6, 2018). Congrats to co-authors Paul Iaizzo, Tim Laske, and Dave Garshelis!

The manuscript 'Direct endoscopic visualization of physiologic His bundle pacing and surrounding anatomy within reanimated human hearts employing Visible Heart methodologies' has been accepted for publication in Heart Rhythm Case Reports. Congrats to co-authors Alex Mattson, and Paul Iaizzo!

The manuscript 'Identification of radiofrequency ablation catheter parameters that may induce intracardiac steam pops: direct visualization of elicitation in reanimated swine hearts' has been accepted for publication in the Journal of Cardiovascular Translational Research. Congrats to co-authors Tinen Iles, Steve Quallich, and Paul Iaizzo!

The manuscript 'Development and utilization of implantable cardiac monitors in free-ranging American black and Eurasian brown bears: system evoluation and lessons learned' has been accepted for publication in Animal Biottelemetry. Congrats to co-authors Tim Laske, Tinen Iles, Dave Garshelis, and Paul Iaizzo!

The manuscript 'The Fixation Tines of the Micra Leadless Pacemaker are Atraumatic to the Tricuspid Valve' has been accepted for publication in PACE (Pacing and Clinical Electrophysiology). Congrats to co-authors Alex Mattson, Jorge Zhingre Sanchez, and Paul Iaizzo!

The manuscript 'Electrical parameters for physiologic His-Purkinje pacing vary by implant location in an ex vivo canine model' has been accepted for publication in Heart Rhythm. Congrats to co-authors Alex Mattson, Elizabeth Mattson, and Paul Iaizzo!
Mikayle Holm and Jorge Zhingre Sanchez successfully passed their oral preliminary exams on September 14th. Congratulations Mikayle and Jorge!
Erik Gaasedelen successfully passed his oral preliminary exams on February 18th. Congratulations Erik!
CONGRATULATIONS to Alex Deakyne and Kaileigh Rock who presented their thesis and earned their masters degrees on January 18.
CONGRATULATIONS to Lars Mattison who presented his thesis and earned his PhD degree on January 28.
CONGRATULATIONS to Alex Mattson who presented his thesis and earned his PhD degree on July 18.
CONGRATULATIONS to Megan Schmidt who presented her thesis and earned her PhD degree on April 20.
CONGRATS to Miles McParland for successfully presenting his Masters work on 12/21!! Integration of Multimodal Aortic Valve Imaging into a Dynamic 3 Dimensional Model in Virtual Reality.

KUDOS to the coauthors Alex Mattson, Mario Soto, & Paul Iaizzo on the publication of their manuscript in Clinical Anatomy, titled; 'The Quantitative Assessment of Epicardial Fat Distribution on Human Hearts: Implications for Epicardial Electrophysiology'.  http://dx.doi.org/10.1002/ca.23194

CONGRATS to the coauthors Federica Sacco, Bruno Paun, Oriol Lehmkuhl, Tinen L. Iles, Paul A. Iaizzo, Guillaume Houzeaux, Mariano Vázquez, Constantine Butakoff, & Jazmin Aguado-Sierra on the acceptance of publication of their manuscript in Frontiers in Physiology – section Computational Physiology and Medicine, titled; 'Left ventricular trabeculations decrease the wall shear stress and increase the intra-ventricular pressure drop in CFD simulations'.

KUDOS to the coauthors Alex Mattson, Mario Soto, & Paul Iaizzo on the acceptance of the publication of their manuscript in Clinical Anatomy, titled; 'The Quantitative Assessment of Epicardial Fat Distribution on Human Hearts: Implications for Epicardial Electrophysiology'.

Congratulations to coauthors Dr. Ashish Singal, Lar Mattison, Charles Soule, John Ballard, Eric Rudie and Dr. Erik Cressman on the publication of their manuscript in the Annals of Biomedical Engineering; 'Assessment of ablative therapies in swine: response on respiratory diaphragm to varying doses'. Such great news!

The Visible Heart Laboratories were featured in a news story on Fox9 about the celebration of 40 years of heart transplants. http://www.fox9.com/news/university-of-minnesota-health-celebrates-40-years-of-heart-transplants

Congratulations to the coauthors Dr. John Spratt, Lars Mattison, Dr. Paul Iaizzo, and Dr. Gabriel Loor on the recent publication of their manuscript in The Journal of Thoracic and Cardiovascular Surgery; 'The ABCs of Autologous Blood Collection for Ex Vivo Preservation'.

CONGRATS to Dr. John Spratt, Lars Mattison, Paul Iaizzo, Gabe Loor on the publication of their manuscript; The ABCs of autologous blood collection for ex vivo organ preservation. Journal of Thoracic Cardiovascular Surgery, 155:433-435. DOI: 10.1016/j.jtcvs.2017.08.036

KUDOS to the coauthors Dr. Ashish Singal, Lars Mattison, Charles Soule and Dr. Paul Iaizzo on the publication of their manuscript in Transactions on Biomedical Engineering. (Effects of Ablation (Radiofrequency, Cryo, Microwave) on Physiologic Properties of the Human Vastus Lateralis)
Gary Williams celebrated his 25th anniversary at the University of Minnesota. Thanks to Gary for all his contributions to the VHL as well as associated institutes at the U!

Former PhD graduate student Maneesh Shrivastav was awarded the Distinguished Alumni Award and Service Always Matters (SAM) Award from his high school in Illinois. While there, Maneesh joined current high school students for a variety of activities including: teaching cardiac anatomy (hands on demo and Atlas of Human Cardiac Anatomy), doing diabetes monitoring, launching a weather balloon, and going on an ecology field trip.
CONGRATULATIONS to former graduate student, Alex Hill (PhD, 2003), for his induction as an IEM Fellow at the 2016 IEM Conference and Retreat on Monday, September 26th!
Alex Hill (PhD, 2003) was recognized as a 2015 Bakken Fellow for his achivements and key contributions to Medtronic. Congratulations Alex!

CONGRATS to co-authors John Spratt, Lars Mattison, Paul Iaizzo, R Brown, H Helms, Tinen Iles, Brian Howard, Angela Panoskaltsis-Mortari, and Gabe Loor on the publication of their manuscript in Transplant International (Title: An experimental study of the recovery of injured porcine lungs with prolonged normothermic cellular ex vivo lung perfusion following donation after circulatory death).

CONGRATULATIONS to Maria Burbano (The effects of electric field and probe orientation on the conductivity of the phrenic nerve post-application of electroporation over time) and Tony Schmitz (Novel visualization of bifurcating coronary stenting techniques and subsequent 3D modeling and printing of deployed devices) on earning their Masters degrees on April 26, 2017!!!!

CONGRATS to co-authors Tony Schmitz, Lars Mattison, Tinen Iles, and Paul Iazzo on the publication of their image paper 'Novel visualization of coronary stenting techniques and subsequent 3D modeling and printing of deployed devices' in the European Society of Cardiology (ESC) Clinical Case Gallery (online case portal).

CONGRATULATIONS to co-authors Paul Iaizzo and Tinen Iles on the acceptance of their manuscript for publication in Magnetic Resonanace in Medicine (Title: Investigating the physiological effects of 10.5T static field exposure on anesthetized swine).

Several researchers presented posters at the Department of Surgery Research Day on May 23rd, including: Megan Schmidt, 'Time variate comparison of in situ and in vitro monophasic action potential recordings', Arpan Patel, 'Physiological response of skeletal muscle to irreversible electroporation', Alex Mattson, '3-dimensional reconstruction and analysis of epicardial adipose in the human heart', Lars Mattison, 'Physiological assessment of cardiac muscle post-irreversible electroporation therapy', John Spratt, 'Lung transplantation from donation after circulatory death donors after prolonged normothermic ex vivo lung perfusion', Mikayle Holm, 'Reconstruction of full body skeleton from CT images of a fresh human cadaver', Jorge Zhingre Sanchez, '3D modeling and visualization of human cadaver organs for clinical and educational applications', Erik Gaasedelen, 'Using Smartphone-based virtual reality to explore internal anatomy of 3D heart models', Charles LeNeave, 'Pharmacologic post-conditioning of DCD swine lungs on EVLP with whole blood: N-acetyl cysteine to minimize ischemic-reperfusion injury'
Congrats to Lillehei Scholar Matthew Welter for presenting his summer research last week!
David Ramirez presenting on IRE of vessels at the World Congress on Electroporation!
Congrats to Dr. Erik Gaasedelen for defending his PhD thesis!
VHL PhD student Alex Deakyne presenting at Stanford this week!
